page.title: 13HALLATON CLUBS & SOCIETIES 2
page.content: The Hallaton and District{Women's {Institute}meets in the Stenning Hall monthly. There are about 25 members. {Snooker}can be played any evening in the upstairs room in the Stenning Hall.{The Hallaton Sports and Social {Club}is organised for and by villagers and the surrounding community, and is another focus for village life. Founded in the early 1980's, the club began by renting the recreation field from the Stenning Charities. There is a football and cricket pitch, and the old grass tennis courts have just been replaced by new hard courts, which are being put to good use. There is also a children's play area still being developed, and a pavilion built from the bricks of old farm buildings by club members. The club holds events throughout the year, and its main fund raising is a Gala Day in August.
